snippet: In 1990, Dr. Pawson and his research team in Toronto identified the SH2 domain, which offered insights about how cells communicate with one another and resolved one of science’s oldest mysteries.
abstract: Anthony Pawson, Canadian cell biologist whose pathbreaking insights about how cells communicate with one another resolved one of science's oldest mysteries, dies at age 60.
lead_paragraph: In 1990, Dr. Pawson and his research team in Toronto identified the SH2 domain, which offered insights about how cells communicate with one another and resolved one of science’s oldest mysteries.

headline.main: Anthony Pawson, Biologist in Cell-Protein Breakthrough, Dies at 60
headline.print_headline:
Anthony Pawson, Biologist, Dies at 60;
Unraveled Mystery of How Cells Interact
